posts.name: Calvin Selin
posts.cooked: I’m trying to to CAD a belt system with multiple pulleys and several bends.  I’m using Onshape, so there’s no path length dimension feature.  How can I find the correct positions for the pulleys?

posts.name: Dominick Ferone
posts.cooked: Does anyone know a good way for cading a 180* belt?

posts.name: Calvin Selin
posts.cooked: Sorry if I don’t understand, but is the variable created referenced in the actual sketch, or is it just guess and check?  (In other words, instead of creating a variable, could you just use the measure tool?)

posts.name: Nuttyman54
posts.cooked: It’s guess and check, the variable just automates the measurement step. As far as I know, there’s no way to create a measured variable in Onshape that can be referenced in the same sketch the measurement is taken from, due to how variables are implemented as features in the tree with parents and children.

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
Use circles that are the correct pitch diameter, then draw tangent lines to each circle in the chain and trim anything that isn’t the belt.

From there you just measure the length of the “belt” and that’s your length (not your teeth count)

Your (length / pitch) is your tooth count. For example, a 300mm length belt at 5mm pitch is 60t

posts.name: Calvin Selin
posts.cooked: Thank You!  I have found, though, that you can just look at the belt gen featurescript to see the length.
